page.title: 14ROCKLEY
page.content: { Rockley}is a tiny village owned by the Manor and has changed very little. Only one new building, a corn drier, has been built, although the old school closed in 1947 is now an antique shop and the church which closed in 1961 is now a restaurant. There are half the inhabitants now, less than fifty, for families are smaller and younger people have moved away. A bus used to call at the village, but there is no public transport today.Although there is no village life, no shop, pub, school or church, the inhabitants enjoy the peaceful country life, watching woodpeckers and nuthatches surrounded by the empty downs.
